english: to talk about; to speak of; to tell; to narrate; to recite; to chant; to indicate; to show
to invite; to ask someone to join; to call (for); to tempt
conditional: sasoeba; sasottara; sasoimashitara; sasowanakereba; sasowanakattara; sasoimasen deshitara

english: to admit; to recognize; to acknowledge; to accept
example: mitome nakereba narimasen (must recognize)
もっと詳しく聞きたい

english: to accost a person; to talk (to someone)
a talk; a story; conversation; a chat; a subject (of a conversation/story/etc.)
example: 話をする (to have a talk)

english: to stuff into; to pack; to cram; to fill; to plug

to be packed (with); to be full (space, schedule, etc.); to be blocked (road, pipe, etc.); to be clogged; to be plugged up; to shorten (width, interval, etc.); to shrink (shirt, word form, etc.); to narrow; to be at a loss; to be har pressed; to end up; to be settled; to stuff
in other words, …; that is to say; that is; I mean; in short; in brief; to sum up; in the end; basically

example: Shiken no tameni hisshide benkyou shita. (I studied hard for the examination.)
ehsou (small size); ehmou (medium size); ehrou (large size); ehkkou sou ehrou (extra large size)

english: to connect; to tie; fasten; to hold hands (te wo tsunagu); to transfer a phone call; (~ to ~ wo tsunagu (connect ~ and ~)); to be put through
temporary solution; stopgap measure; filler (i.e., time, space); patch
sensitive; delicate (feelings, sense, etc.); dainty; delicate (e.g., fingers); fine; slim
to sew; to stitch; to weave one's way (e.g., through a crowd)
example: Haha ga uwagi no hokorobi o nutte kureta. (My mother stitched up a rip on the jacket.)
antonym: yoko (horizontal; side; width)

english: to get back together again; to be reconciled

example: antonym: kitsui (tight)

english: to get nervous; to be nervous
to come apart at the seams; to be ripped; to be torn; to begin to open; to begin to bloom; to smile broadly; to break into a smile

example: どんどん奇麗になっていく (getting prettier and prettier)
どのように猫を綴るの？ (How do you spell "neko"/"cat"?)

english: to continue (～を); to proceed; masu-stem + つづける (continue to ~)
example: shoubousho ga mieru made arukitsudukenasai. (Keep walking until you see a fire station.)

english: to be continued; to follow; to last; to go on; to occur again and again; to lead to; to connect to
example: ame wa ato sanshuukan tsuzukimasu ka? (Will the rain continue for three more weeks?)
絹のブラウス

english: absolutely; unconditionally; absolutely; definitely; certainly; by all means; (ぜったい + ～しない = never ~)
example: 絶対に

english: breaking off a relationship; permanent breach of friendship; rupture
to cease; to die out; to end; to be cut off
example: Ano kazoku niwa momegoto ga taenai. (There are constant troubles in that family.)
kyuuryou ga yasui/ooi desu.; もっと給料のいい仕事を探さなくちゃ。(I should get a better paying job.)

english: often; fairly; pretty (degree); enough; so (degree); sufficient; quite a bit; That would be find; That wouldn't be necessary.
example: 結構上手ですね。 kekkou jouzu desu ne. (he's) pretty good (at something)!; はい、結構です。 (It's all right (permission).)

english: concerning the result (as opposed to the means used to achieve the result or the original goal)
result; consequence; an outcome; an effect
example: Shiken no kekka wa asu happyou ni narimasu. (The results of the examination will be published tomorrow.)

english: obedient; meek; docile; unaffected; honest; frank; up front
great; lovely; cool; superb; attractive; nice; beautiful; wonderful
to distract; to divert; to conceal
appointment; (lit. "promise"); to promise; to keep a promise
example: (約束を守る) yakusoku o mamoru (keep a promise); yakusoku ni ikanakerba narimasen. (I have to go to an appointment.)

english: food; provisions; nourishment; source of encouragement

example: nebaneba natto
sekitan no kona (coal powder)
簡単に (easily)

english: to build; to pile up; to amass
pipe; cylinder; tube; gun barrel; gun
at last; finally; in the end; after all; etc.; and so on
example: Hannichi mo tsuri o shita ga, toutou ippiki mo tsurenakatta. (I was fishing for a half day, but didn't catch any fish in the end.)
anata no egao no kawaii desu. (Your smile is cute.)
（笑）- used in plain writing to indicate laughter/smiles

english: good; excellent; fine; splendid; noble; magnificent; gorgeous
present: Kanojo wa rippana keireki o motteiru. (She has a brilliant career.)

english: to stand up; to rise; to depart; to leave
example: 十時に立ちます (I'm leaving at ten o'clock.)

english: to stop; to halt; to stand still
to stand against; to oppose; to face
to peep (through); to peek; to examine (esp. covertly); to await (one's chance); to guess; to infer; to gather
suddenly; abruptly; unexpectedly; all at once
to thrust into something; to plunge into; to go into deeply; to meddle; to interfere; to retort; to riposte
to run swiftly; to dash to race; to rush
to poke (repeatedly, lightly); to nudge; to peck at (e.g., one's food, someone's faults)
to determine (esp. a culprit or underlying cause); to pin down; to make sure; to locate; to identify; to find out; to ascertain

example: このはこ、からっぽだ。 (This box is empty.);　タンクが空っぽです。 (The tank is empty.)

english: to be available; to be vacant; to be open
to become less crowded; to thin out; to get empty; to be hungry
to punch a hole (in something, e.g., paper)

example: 穴があく (a hole opens up; a hole develops); 茶色の四つ穴ボタン chairo no yotsu ana botan (brown 4-hole button )

english: to pile up; to stack; to load (a car, ship, etc.); to pack; to accumulate; to acquire
ear (of plant); head (of plant); point; tip
type; a kind; a sort; variety; category; counter for different sorts of things
example: どんな種類の寿司がありますか？　(What kind of sushi is there?)；同じ種類のですか。（おなじしゅるいのですか。）(Of the same kind?)

english: seed; kind; variety; quality; tone; material; matter; subject; theme; (news) copy; cause; source; trick; secret; inside story
degree; amount; grade; standard; about; approximately
to move; to transfer; to migrate
to move (house); to transfer (department); to elapse (passage of time)
to change; to swap; to substitute; to transfer
to take the name of; to call oneself; to pretend; to feign; to purport
to hide; to keep to oneself

english: to write (trans.); to put down; to compose; to describe
example: Watashi wa mainichi nikki o kaiteiru. (I keep a diary every day.)
conditional: kakeba; kaitara; kakimashitara; kakanakereba; kakanakattara; kakimasen deshitara

english: furthermore; again; after all; more and more; moreover; even more
to bend; to crook; to lean; to yield ( a point); to depart (from a principle)
to turn (right/left) (corner を direction に); to bend; to curve; to warp; to twist; to be crooked; to be askew
example:
右に曲がります。
migi ni magarimasu. (I'm turning to the right.)
つぎのかどでひだりえまがってください (Turn left at the next corner.); でもじつはもっとふるい曲がすき

夜、曇って寒くなるでしょう。 (In the evening, it will become cloudy and cold. )

english: to act recklessly; to behave recklessly; to act rashly
to act violently; to rage; to struggle; to be rioutous
to become violent; to act violently; to rage; to struggle; to be rioutous
to get dark; to end; to come to an end; to run out; to be sunk (e.g., in despair); to be lost
to live; to get by; to make a living
example: 安心して暮らす (live in peace)

english: news coverage; collecting data (e.g., for an article); interview
to regain; to recover; to get back
to take in; to bring in; to introduce; to import; to win over; to please; to flatter; to defraud of; to swindle; to embezzle; to be busy; to be in confusion; to have trouble
to take back; to get back; to regain; to recover
accomidation; reception; housing; seating; custody; admission
on the other side; on the opposite side
to oppose; to disagree; to object to (～に)
example: hantai desu. (I disagree.); sansei desu. (I agree.); dareka watashitachi no kekkon hantai suru ka na? (Who would oppose our marriage?)
hantai gawa (opposite (side))
参考にして (as a reference)

english: to participate; to join; to attend
humble expression of to go and to come (いく and くる)
to go; to come (humble); to visit; to be worried; to be beaten; to be very tired; to be struck by (a girl's charm)
example: Hai, tadaima mairimasu.　 はい，ただいま参ります。(Certainly. I'll come right away.); Kotoshi no natsu no atsusa niwa hontouni maitta. (I couldn't stand the heat of this summer at all.); 電車が参ります。(The train is arriving.)

english: I give up!; I'm beaten.; I don't know what to do.
egg; spawn; roe; beginning; origin; infancy
example: also "tama," e.g., neko no tama
危険ですので絶対にマネしないでください. kiken desu no de zettai ni mane shinai de kudasai. (As this is dangerous, please don’t copy.)

english: dangerous; Watch out!; look out!; warning!; risky; critical

It is not safe for you to go out by yourself so late at night.危ない

It cannot be helped; It is no use (doing); cannot stand; be anxious (to do); There is nothing to be done.; That's impossible!; I can't help it.; That can't be helped.

example: 仕事がたくさんあったから、給料が多い。 (There was a lot of work, so the salary is high.)

example: あしたの いまごろ ashita no imagoro - tomorrow about this time
人生山あり谷あり (There are hard times and good times in life.); 僕の人生はタイムリミットがある。(My life has a time limit.)

市（し）の人口

example: I traded a used car for a new one. (Chuukosha o utte shinsha to koukanshita.)

to be mixed; to be blended with; to associate with; to mingle with; to join

a direct object particle often used with "walk," "run," "go through," etc., when speaking of continuous motion and a finite place or distance.; along ~
expressly; specially; doing something especially rather than incidentally

japanese: リレーショナルデータベース

english: finally; at last; barely; narrowly; hardly; only just; gradually; little by little; degrees
in order to (e.g., meet goal); so that; seems to; appears to be; hoping or wishing for something
example: Piano o jouzi ni hikeru you ni mainichi renshuu shite iru. (In order to be able to play the piano well, I practice every day.); Furansugo o jouzi ni hanaseru you ni naritai. (I want to be able to speak French well. [you ni naritai = want to become so that...]); One very handy aspect of you ni is that it can be used to start an idea which is completed (mentally) by the other party. Compare these examples, with their literal translations: Ashita rokuji ni okireru you ni, mezamashidokei o setto shite ne. (So that you can get up at six tomorrow, set the alarm clock, okay?); 彼に明日話さないように言ってください。(Tell him not to talk tomorrow.)
toukyou ni youkoso. (Welcome to Tokyo.)
ゆでた (boiled)

also: (nanto)
漢字なんて書けない。Kanji nante kakenai. (There is no way that I can write kanji.); nante itteta? 何て言ってた？(What was said?)

english: like (filler word); kind of; kinda; things like ~; or something like that (often derogatory); and things like that

example: なるべく早く (as fast as possible)

english: to become; to get; to grow; to be; to reach; to attain; to result in; to prove to be; to consist of; to be composed of; to succeed; to be complete; to change into
example: narisou (seems will be); こんな気持になったことはない。 (I have never felt this way before.); narisou (seems will become); Paatii no ato daidokoro wa kitanaku narimasu. Anata wa nihon no rekishi ga suki ni narimasu yo.; メアリーさんは前より日本語が上手になりました。(Mary has become better in Japanese than before.)

english: to get (to some quality or status); to become
example: yawarakaku natte kita (it became/got soft)
ナッツ類（るい）でアレルギー反応（はんおう）を起こします（おこします）。 (I'm allergic to nuts.)

english: to take long; to have difficulty
example: 今日の仕事、なかなかおわらないなあ。

english: no matter how; no matter who; no matter how much
example: どんなに安くても買いたくありません。(I don't want to buy it no matter how cheap it is.); だれがしても結果は同じです。(No matter who does it, the result will be the same.); いくら読んでも意味が分かりませんでした。(I couldn't understand it no matter how many times I read it.)
donna taipu no heya ga arimasu ka. (What kind of room do you have?)

english: unthinkable; unexpected; outrageous; offensive; terrible; absolutely not!; preposterous!; what a thing to say!; no way!; bullshit!
how long; how much; to what extent

example: dore kurai kakaru? (How long does it take?)

english: for the time being; for now; temporarily; at once; first of all
japanese: とりあえず；取りあえず
トラベラーズチェックを換金

example: dono you ni desu ka? (How?)
車が多いと、どのような問題がありますか。

english: how long; how far; how much; to what degree; to what extent
example: dono kurai kakarimasu ka? (How long does it take?)

as (i.e., in the role of); for (i.e., from the viewpoint of); apart from ~ (used to change the topic); (before a negative form) even (e.g., "not even a single person"); (after a volitional form) thinking that ~, trying to ~

example: ところで、イタリアにスターバックスがないのは知ってる？（By the way, did you know that there are no Starbucks in Italy?)

example: Umaku iku darou to omotta tokoroga, shippai shita. (While I thought it would go well, it failed.)

english: to do something in readiness for; to get something (needful) done

word: doki doki suru; doki doki shichau; dokidoki iku
english: I'm excited (nervous/anxious, lit. my heart is pounding).; that sounds exciting
example: Also: waku waku suru; waku waku shichau
~ ni ha dou yatte ikeba ii desu ka? (How do I go to ~?)
hakubutsukan ni wa douyatte iku n desu ka? (How do I get to the museum?)

english: much (thanks); very (sorry); quite (regret); really; mostly; somehow; doumo has ambiguous meaning and can be used to say "Thank you," "I'm sorry," "My deepest condolences," Long time, no see. How are you doing?"
in some way or another; one way or another
example: dou ni ka naru yo. (It will be one way or another.)

english: Anything is fine.; I don't care.
japanese:
どうでもいいよ。
かまわない。

english: How did you like…?; How about…?; What's going on?; How's it going?

japanese: どうぞうよろしくお願いします。

english: anyway; in any case; at any rate; after all; at best; at most; at all

example: dou shitara ii deshou ka? (What should I do?)

word: dou shita no? (concerned inquiry); douka shita no? (unsuspecting inquiry); nanka atta no? (unsuspecting inquiry)

example: どうか分かって。(Please understand.)

word: dou iu imi?; dou iu tsumori?

english: what kind of; how; in what way; somehow

example: kono tango dou hatsuon suru no? (How do you pronounce this word?)

english: how; how about; in what way
example: (~ ha dou ittara ii ka; ~ ha dou iu?; ~ha nan to iimasu ka?) (How do you say ~?)
弁天というレストランを知りませんか。(Do you know the restaurant called Benten?)

english: as much as possible; as much as one can do; as soon as possible.
example: できるだけ早く君の親に会う。(I'll meet your parents as soon as possible.); できるだけ、 早く帰ってね。 dekiru dake hayaku kaette ne. Come back as soon as possible.

english: eating with one's fingers; snitching food; secret eating; food snatched and eaten without the meal starting; embezzlement; misappropriation; exploiting something
to be tied together; to be connected to; to be related to
example: 電話がつながらない。

english: contraction of "to iu" (e.g., used for quoting speech); meaning; called; said
to hunt a spy; to put a tail on someone; to stalk

example: つえで（with a stick)

english: at last; finally; in the end; after all
example: Matteita noni, Aya wa tsuini konakatta. (I was waiting for Aya, but she didn't come after all.)
ほうき (broom)

english: advert leaflet; scattered item; scattering; sushi rice in a box or bowl with a variety of ingredients sprinkled on top

example: ちょうどいい (just right)；ちょうど１２時です。 (It's just 12 o'clock.)

english: super-; ultra-; hyper-; very; really; over (after a number or counter); more than; (a prefix indicating excess)
example: chouhayai (super fast); チョウ行きたい。 (I really want to go.)

english: properly; diligently; seriously; earnestly; reliably; steadily; perfectly; exactly; orderly; punctually; regularly; sufficiently; satisfactorily; (expresses emphasis)
flickering; flashing on and off; twinkling; glittering

example: kanojo ha dare ni de mo shinsetsu desu. (She is kind to everyone.)

english: covered by; full of; covered all over; implying (negatively) that something is full of/covered by (e.g., mistakes, scratches, etc.)
example: 穴だらけ (covered with holes)

english: to save money (～を); (trans.); to store up; to accumulate
conditional: tamereba; tametara; tamemashitara; tamenakereba; tamenakattara; tamemasen deshitara

english: to be saved (e.g., money) (intrans.);  accumulated; pile up
conditional: tamareba; tamattara; tamarimashitara; tamaranakereba; tamaranakattara; tamarimasen deshitara

english: because … (explanation); but; even so; after all
just now (used with the past tense; indicates completion); just; has just

example: tatta ~ shika; tadashi; tatta no; choudo

english: presently; right away; right now; just now; I'm back; Here I am; I'm home!

example: ただの冗談だよ。 (It was just a joke.)
コーラがほしいだけ。 (I only want a Coke.)

english: informal postpositional subject marker; used to quote what you have heard; informal variant of とand follows the short form much like と行っていました and そうです.; You can use ～って in place of the quotation particle と before verbs like 言う; contraction of ～というのは; informal, conversational form; useful for asking questions or introducing new, unfamiliar topics into a conversation
example: メアリーさん、今日は忙しいって。あした、試験があるんだって。 (Mary says she's busy today. She says she has an exam tomorrow.)

english: particle used to indicate that speaker is trying to recall something
example: mada atta kke (Is there still any ~? (I can't remember))

example: 彼は日本へ行きたがっています。 (He wants to go to Japan)

english:
used to guess an outcome; Rules for conjugation:
1) Verbs must be changed to the stem.
2) The 「い」 in i-adjectives must be dropped except for 「いい」.
3)「いい」 must first be conjugated to 「よさ」
4) For all negative tenses, the 「い」 must be replaced with 「さ」.
5) This grammar does not work with plain nouns.

english: a breath; a pause; a rest; an effort
example: Hitoiki tsuite kara, mata hajimeyou. (Let's take a little rest, and start again.)

english: suffix used to convey respect when referring to a respected individual or group with higher status.
and it's in addition to what I've said

example:
最近、映画しか見てない。; Lately, I’ve only been watching movies.; ないのか？!
Is that all you can do?!; ありません。
I have no interesting in anything but Japan.

明日、雨が降るそうだ。- I hear that it's going to rain tomorrow.
（２）　毎日会いに行ったそうです。- I heard he went to meet everyday.

Don't forget to add 「だ」 for nouns or na-adjectives.
（３）　彼は、高校生だそうです。- I hear that he is a high school student.

english: It looks like ~.; It seems that ~ (plain verb + "you desu")
example: ここには誰もいないようだ。 (It looks like no one is here.)

english: "te ha"; must ~; verb suffix used in plain speech to replace "~kute wa narimasen"
example: ikanakute wa narimasen (literally: "It's no go if I don't go" = "I must go"); "Ikanakute wa" tends to be shortened to "ikanakucha" or "ikanakya," and the "...narimasen" part dropped altogether in casual speech.; kawanakucha (= kawanakute ha)

english: plain form of "~kute ha"; must ~; verb suffix used in plain speech to replace "~kute wa narimasen"
example: ikanakute wa narimasen (literally: "It's no go if I don't go" = "I must go"); "Ikanakute wa" tends to be shortened to "ikanakucha" or "ikanakya," and the "...narimasen" part dropped altogether in casual speech.

english: suffix used to make some words plural
example: anatatachi; watshitachi; bokutachi; oneesantachi
katte choudai. (Please buy it.); sore o totte choudai. (Please pick it up.)

word: ~te itadakitai desu; ~wo itadakitai no desu ga
english: I want you to do ~ (something) for me.; I'd like ~
example: kore wo eigo ni yakushite itadakitai desu.; kore o katte itadakitai desu.; kore o yonde itadakitai desu.; eigo de kaite itadakitai no desu ga.

english: (in surprise or wonder) Oh! ; Huh? ; Hey!

example: Imouto wa kami o chiisaku chigitte asondeiru. (My sister is tearing paper off in small pieces.)

an expression of excitement or enthusiasm, equivalent to saying "all right!" or "okay!" in English.; often pronounced yoush.

appearance; manner; used in many ways to express similarity; When the sentence ends in 「よう」, you must explicitly express the state of being by adding 「だ」, 「です」, or 「でございます」. When directly modifying nouns or na-adjectives, you must use the 「の」 particle for nouns or attach 「な」 to na-adjectives.
example: ここには、誰もいないようだ。- Looks like no one is here.; 学生のようだ。- Looks like it's a student.; ここは静かなようだ。- Looks like it's quiet.

to be extinct; to be extinguished; to disappear; to vanish; to terminate; to lapse; to annihilate
to decay, go bad, be depressed
